definition: to cover all at one glance (idiom)/a panoramic view
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
extra/surplus/remaining/remainder after division/(following numerical value) or more/in excess of (some number)/residue (math.)/after/I/me

sentences.english: A few days later the weather finally cleared, revealing a completely white north face.
sentences.chinese: 数日后，天气转好，白雪皑皑的整个北壁一览无余。

sentences.english: But his famous impatience is still close to thesurface.
sentences.chinese: 可是，他那著名的急脾气，仍一览无余。

sentences.english: Boiled in the sun, so that more and more sweeping views of the Gobi.
sentences.chinese: 白灼的阳光，令戈壁越发一览无余。

sentences.english: The top view, Taylor's plain, Wen River flow, take in everything in a glance.
sentences.chinese: 山顶远望，泰莱平原，汶河西流，一览无余。

sentences.english: Sitting by the window as the lights turns on, you can keep the wonderful view of the bund.
sentences.chinese: 华灯初上，临窗而坐，整个外滩的景色一览无余。

definition: to take in the whole scene at once/to have a panoramic view
to overlook/to look down from a height
to get a bird's-eye view/bird's-eye view/broad overview
to see through/perspective/to examine by fluoroscopy (i.e. X-ray)
to cover/to mask/to cover up or conceal (the truth etc)
conspicuous/to make sth stand out/make sth prominent
to lay bare/to come to light
to come out/to emerge/to reveal/to display
